intro: Raphanistrum innocuum, commonly known as the common water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wet meadows, marshes, and along riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, spicy scent, while its roots are fibrous and can be harvested for culinary use. Raphanistrum innocuum plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
